Updated November     pm



The grass is looking pretty green for the UW Farm PERIOD

In a unanimous vote last night the Campus Sustainability Fund CSF committee approved a  proposal that would go toward the expansion of the UW Farm PERIOD

 said Justin Hellier CSF committee vice chair PERIOD 

Sylvia Gozdek a senior involved with the UW Farm said that part of the approved budget would be put toward funding student internships at the farm which would eventually include payment for interns who work on the farm PERIOD Nina Arlein farm director said that the UW Farm hopes to be able to pay these interns out of profits in the future PERIOD

 Arlein said PERIOD

Representatives of the UW Farm answered questions at the meeting about the proposed budget which Beth Wheat education coordinator at the farm said is an overestimate of what they expect to actually spend PERIOD

 Wheat said PERIOD

Michelle Venetucci Harvey social media coordinator for the UW Farm spoke about the plans to add an acre of farm to the UW Center for Urban Horticulture which is a part of the UW Botanic Gardens PERIOD

 Harvey said PERIOD 

Another goal for the UW Farm is the expansion of food production that would become available on campus PERIOD

Harvey said the UW Farm will retain the onethird acre on main campus in order to remain visible but that the additional acre would be more productionoriented and would allow the farms to produce enough food to sell on campus PERIOD Harvey said they want to  in order to show UW students and faculty an example of environmental sustainability PERIOD

 Harvey said commenting on the farms current size limiting foodproduction abilities PERIOD

Getting food onto campus would require the UW Farm to sell its produce to UW Housing and Food Services and develop a partnership with the unit which Fisk said would help the UW Farm in the long run PERIOD

 Fisk said PERIOD

The new farm will also be partnering with Seattle Tilth a nonprofit organic gardening and urban ecology organization that works with youth in Seattle PERIOD

 Harvey said PERIOD

Harvey said that partnering with Tilth will help the UW Farm fulfill its mission of engaging with diversity PERIOD

 Harvey said PERIOD 

Julie Fisk CSF coordinator said that the UW Farms expansion proposal 

 Harvey said PERIOD 

Reach reporter Sarah Schweppe at newsdailyuw.com PERIOD

Expectations are high for the Washington football program PERIOD The fans players coaches and even the nation are familiar with dominant Husky teams on the gridiron PERIOD

Carl Bonnell QB  After losing his job to redshirt freshman Jake Locker during the offseason Bonnell once again played himself into the mix with a strong spring PERIOD Now he has worked himself solidly into the No PERIOD  spot on the depth chart PERIOD

Casey Bulyca and Morgan Rosborough OG  Bulyaca has finally lived up to his potential as one of the strongest men on the team while Rosborough who came in at nearly  pounds is finally at playing weight PERIOD

E.J PERIOD Savannah LB  Savannah took the starting WIL position away from fellow junior Chris Stevens and continues to be one of the biggest hitters and playmakers on the defense PERIOD

J.R PERIOD Hasty RB  It isnt so much that Hasty has played terrible as much as it is that Louis Rankin has increased his lead as No. pERIOD The coaches meanwhile are waiting for the player who broke almost every state rushing record to show up PERIOD

Anthony Russo WR  Russo has been dealing with nagging injuries all spring and may have been passed by the impressive Marcel Reece as well as Corey Williams who came out of nowhere this spring and worked himself back into the rotation PERIOD

Robert Lewis TE  Lewis had trouble separating himself from his competitors and as a senior may be forced to watch Johnie Kirton and Michael Gottlieb play ahead of him PERIOD

While the Huskies saw vast improvement from the  and  seasons in  and  coach Tyrone Willingham was emphatic during the spring season saying that the time to become a bowl team is now PERIOD

When asked what the players got most out of the spring practices Willingham said 

Much of the burden in becoming a winning program falls on the quarterback and Jake Locker the heralded recruit from Ferndale Wash. has assumed the role of No PERIOD  quarterback PERIOD

The youngster has shown immeasurable promise but also the inconsistency of inexperience PERIOD

 Locker said PERIOD 

While many on the team are excited with the talent and leadership the firstyear quarterback brings quarterback Carl Bonnells play has spoken for itself PERIOD

The senior threw three touchdowns in the spring game and he gives the UW a morethanserviceable backup PERIOD The quarterback position is just one example of the teams superior depth and talent compared to past years PERIOD

 Bonnell said PERIOD

Locker admitted that Bonnells superior play has driven him to work harder PERIOD

 Locker said PERIOD 

Another position to keep an eye on is running back PERIOD While sophomore J.R PERIOD Hasty brings youth and an NFL pedigree to the Husky backfield it has been senior Louis Rankin that has wowed coaches with his consistency PERIOD

 defensive coordinator Kent Baer said PERIOD

As the No PERIOD  running back Rankin said that instead of trying to make a big play on every carry he worked hard to improve his blocking and hitting the hole PERIOD

 offensive coordinator Tim Lappano said PERIOD

Another standout offensive is junior transfer student Marcel Reece PERIOD The 6foot3inch 240pound man had three touchdown receptions in the spring game and at times he looked unstoppable PERIOD Other offensive players that made names for themselves are guards Casey Bulyca and Morgan Rosborough and wide receiver Corey Williams PERIOD

On defense the strength appears to be at the linebacker positions PERIOD Senior Dan Howell leads the group but Donald Butler and E.J PERIOD Savannah have more than held their own in the spring season PERIOD

 Savannah said PERIOD 

With only eight defensive backs on the roster right now Baer admitted that the Huskies will need help from some of the incoming freshmen PERIOD Other defenders that stood out this spring are defensive end Caesar Rayford and safety Jason Wells PERIOD

Now its time to hit the weights again and Willingham told his team to prepare for the summer offseason PERIOD

 he said PERIOD

Reach reporter Joshua Mayers at sportsthedaily.washington.edu PERIOD
